alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 1:50PM PST until January 01 at 2:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PST MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, large remnant breaking waves of 5 to 9 feet in Orange County and 6 to 12 feet in San DIego County. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding of low-lying beach parking lots and boardwalks. * WHERE...San Diego and Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...Through 2 AM Monday. Surf and coastal flooding will decline substantially late this afternoon and evening. * IMPACTS...Large breaking waves may sweep people off jetties and docks. Strong rip currents will pose a risk of ocean drowning. Flooding of low-lying beach parking lots, boardwalks and roads near the beach. Beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Locations most susceptible to flooding in Orange County include Seal Beach, Sunset Beach, and Newport Beach. Locations most susceptible to flooding in San Diego County include Cardiff and Seaside State Beaches, portions of Del Mar, La Jolla Shores, Mission Beach, and Imperial Beach.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
